page.title: 06WESTFIELDS ASSESSMENT CENTRE
page.content: Westfields Assessment Centre is housed in a mill owners house, which was built in 1868. It was extended as a childrens home and then in 1976 it became a residential centre for 36 {disturbed children.}These children spend 6 weeks or more at the Centre during which time they are{assessed for suitable long term treatment either at their own home under the supervision of a social worker or at {special schools. The teaching staff, social workers and care staff are all required to report on each child at regular{case {conferences.}Good behaviour can earn a child privileges eg. unescorted visits to the swimming baths. Outdoor activities such as{orienteering}and {camping}are encouraged. The children live in family groups of 4-8 persons which creates a friendly atmosphere.
